reviews.review_msg: Best university prof I ever had. Everyone says he's a bad prof, but they never even bother to ask for help. He was very knowledgeable, you just had to ask for help. He was the first and last professor I had that threw a pizza party. Best prof ever

Literally just an online class with flipitphysics, the lectures and activity guides he provides don't have anything to with the midterms or the final exam (its useless). You can still excel in this class, you just need to understand and learn everything from the online pre lectures, which is incredibly sad considering this should a physical class.

Dr. Alberding spent no time preparing for lectures. He never does any example problems in class. We had to listen to the winded dude on flip it physics pre-lectures and sit though him going through textbook slides all to learn nothing. Then waste time doing activity guides, Physics 2 is a hard class to begin with and he makes it harder. Look Luck

If you wanna to pass the course, remember to attend the class while you just using iclicker to guess everything he said in the question in his lecture by doing nonsense flip it physics and also if u wanna pass the class get a c- well, gl my friend you have to borrow books from library doing tons of works to understand the things he saying.

Avoid it at all costs. A good grade is achievable b/c activity guides are allowed in the exam but you're guaranteed to learn nothing at all. You have to buy smartphysics for both 140 and 141 and basically watch lectures and do tons of homework on your own time that make no sense, and then do boring uncoordinated, self-directed experiments in class.
One of the worst I've seen, trust me

LOADS and LOAAADS of Homework/Assignment...etc etc.......Speaks for half hr..and then disappears leaving T.A behind. SmartPhysics is horrible......watch videos aint gonna help a percent.....for such a HARD HARD Course....I wrote stuff in exam.....just passed with C-....... So relieved...Smartphysics thing is over.
You don't understand even a single word from his lectures.

Well he's not a bad guy and I feel that he was honestly trying to help but it just wasn't working for me. I couldn't even do half of the homework assignments cuz they were so hard and would take hours. I just had to study hard for the midterms and pass the practical and formal report cuz the Activity guides were easy. AVOID THIS COURSE IF U CAN!!!

The labs within this course are absolutely stupid, and never made any sense to me. This course takes A LOT of effort.Midterms are very hard and the final can be somewhat fair with respect to the class average.Sarah is a very strict professor,and can give you the attitude most of the time,so don't try to screw around with her. this class is too much
expects you to know too much, tests are on the harder side, needs to lecture more and go over problems
Great guy and good father, awful teacher.
hes a great prof and a great guy
Wish he was more passionate in teaching, not half baked interest and attitude towards students in physics
Definitely my worst nightmare going taking his class
he's better now, do the experiments in class these days and do well in practical midterm and you should find it easy to pass

For future students: Peter assumes you did preview before class.Take notes and Flipit questions before class Include flipit homework. Exam contains activities in class,flipit and sample exams. Practice them couple times until they show up in your dream. Exceptions are unacceptable(Late homework etc).
He is easy-going when students follow his rule.
Take it with some other professor, if you can.
NOT GOOD PROFESSOR . DID ALL ON MY OWN TO SCORE GRADES. NO CREDIT TO HIM.

He might be a good person but he definitely not a good instructor. His lecture is clueless and his hw is even harder than mit hw. In the lab he would gather you around and tell you guys something then he hope everyone will remember it he doesn't even want to build the circuit he shouldn't teach physics honestly
The professor gives a tough time for students. He barely teaches in lectures and makes his lectures way too long to the point where no information from the lectures were used in the assessments.

If you can choose any other professor by any chance, DO NOT CHOOSE HIM. You can complete this course without him if you choose him. He barely teaches anything in the class and explains nothing clearly. Worst professor you could ever met. Try praying to every god you know if you take his course, cause its much more useful than his lecture anyway.
Congratulations if you have him as your instructor, especially to those who have to take PHYS courses.
Well Be sure that u are a good self-learner cuz 99% of the time he is jist sitting or ghosted, if u wanna ask sth he is ususlly short tempered So, i wont say good luck ,it wont help
I dont like him for sure
Awesome prof. Very good and entertaining plus is a lenient marker. Cracks jokes and loves Breaking Bad and The Wire which BTW are both awesome tv series.
A course with amazing things to be learnt and a very poor method of teaching them. Loved all the information, but this course is bogged down in irrelevant paperwork and poorly planned demonstrations.
He is an amazing prof. The course in general, is bad, but he does his level best to make it interesting
Rasoul makes the most of a poorly designed course. He is a nice guy and cares about your education.

I'm quite late but I had Daria for 140 as well as 141, while the course is structured to be quite brutal, I believe it teaches students to learn to how to learn at their own self pace and how to work with others and structure good reports. Make sure to read the textbook before class though because it helps a lot.

Bless Daria's soul, this class is  not for the weak. its structured for you to do textbook readings before class and labs each day in class. it is tough to fully grasp all concepts if you do not particularly learn best that way, however, daria truly cares and is very inspirational and motivational to have everyone try, and do their absolute best

Overall, very kind and caring prof, very lenient with deadlines and likes to listen to student opinion. The overall grade breakdown of the class is really fair, exams fit perfectly within allotted time and they were extremely fair in content. Only issue was that the labs would often be too lengthy, overall great prof.

Daria could be the worst prof a student can run into. She is difficult to reach out to. She makes her students go through tedious and overwhelming in-class activities while giving very little to lecturing itself. Her midterms is another   story; they can be quite lengthy compared to the given time. Don't recommend her at all!

I don't understand how this prof is even allowed to teach a subject like physics. She seems so lazy to teach. She goes thru the lecture notes really quick, just to leave her students do the lengthy in-class activities/lab with almost very little knowledge of the concepts and the physics behind them. And they are done three times a week!

Not surprised that the class average is B-, though it could have been lower if it wasn't for the curve. Daria does not seem to care about her students success or even their understanding of the subject. A very bad and lame prof!

Well all the profs I have came across did  a way better job in lecturing, and explaining the material/concepts. Her lecture notes are vague and confusing! Try to avoid her whenever you can unless you want to grind through the course material for almost the whole semester to understand it all by yourself :)

Her midterms are difficult no matter how hard you study, as the easy sample midterms she posts on canvas do not reflect the real difficulity of the actual midterm itself! Her lecture notes are not much of a help either!

Such a lame  professor! Her lecture notes are confusing; they are not written professionally and clearly, so get ready to read through the textbook even though it's not as helpful as you may think. She rushes through the course material just to get us do the lab/activities for most of the lecture! Also she does not bother replying to emails at all!

What a horrible course and prof! The lecture notes are nothing more than scribbles! Only the first few minutes of the lecture (usually a maximum of 10-15 minutes) are dedicated to lecturing, while the rest (~ 95 minutes) are spent on labs/activities. Get ready to go through these unnecessarily long and tedious activities three times a week!

Daria is kind and this class is very fun as it is all just group work. You have to teach yourself with the textbook and labs because the lectures on complex topics are only about 10 minutes. The tests are difficult if you don't understand the material fully.

Virtually the same as PHYS140 with labs and a final project except with the addition of a lab test and different material. Dr A herself is a pretty friendly and chill prof but like 140 expects you to read the textbook each class and unlike 140 you are pretty screwed if you don't because the material is pretty theoretical. Otherwise cool class.
One of the best proffs i ever had. such a great personality. makes everything easy and she's never mean to anyone. Oh and she looks really pretty :) take her as your physics proff
Very helpful and fun to be around. She has a great sense of humour and is extremely fair in her exams.
